content: With https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/6201 Clippy now has a configuration option for an MSRV. You can either set it in the Clippy configuration file or on nightly (requires custom_inner_attributes feature) with #![clippy::msrv = "1.40.0"]. When this conf is set, lints that require a specific Rust version won't trigger if the MSRV isn't met.
These are the lints, this config option currently applies to: https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#msrv (more to come)
That's awesome! This is the main reason I silence clippy lints so it's great to have a way to do it systematically and in one place :)

This will hit nightly on December 4th if everything goes as planned. We (well, I) also want to do a blog post (rust internals) about this new shiny feature. Mainly to ask people to tell us more lints, that can profit from this option.
